page.title: 20Village Life in Melchbourne
page.content: Inhabitants of Melchbourne have very different occupations; a brail printer, a solicitor, a computer consultant, a kitchen designer,a headmistress and farm workers to name but a few. Apart from work there are many village activities, organising and attending discos, barbecues and seasonal activities. Raising money for the Church is a major priority. Many villagers give Â£1 a week towards the Â£70,000 that is required. At weekends gardens take priority, with the sound of hedge trimmers and lawnmowers being heard throughout. The surrounding farms are all tenanted by one farmer from an Insurance Company. The land has all been managed very sensitively and sheep still graze in Home Park under ancient oak trees.
